origin.li: O.S., Temnykh A.N. Starovoytov, I.I. Glebov, G.V. Khen, A.Ya. Efimkin, A.M. Slabinsky, and V.V. Sviridov of Pacific Fisheries Research Center (TINRO-Center), Vladivostok, Russia

citeinfo.title: The Results of Trawling Survey in the Epipelagic Layer of the Russian Economic Zone in the Bering Sea During, August - October, 2002

abstract.p: The results of complex survey in the epipelagic layer of the western Bering Sea in September - October, 2002 on the research vessel TINRO are examined. The data on oceanologic conditions is presented along with information on allocation and abundance on main zooplankton groups, and quantitative distribution of nekton. The abundance and biomass of fish and cephalopods in the western Bering Sea and adjacent Pacific waters are evaluated. The quantitative distribution of salmon is studied very closely. The information on salmon feeding in different areas of the western Bering Sea is included. The brief analysis of the current status of plankton and nekton epipelagic communities of the western Bering Sea is offered.

[Reference: Temnykh, O.S., A.N. Starovoytov, I.I. Glebov, G.V. Khen, A.Ya. Efimkin, A.M. Slabinsky, V.V. Sviridov. 2003. The results of trawling survey in the epipelagic layer of the Russian Economic Zone in the Bering Sea during September - October, 2002. (NPAFC Doc. 682 Rev. 2) 39p. Pacific Scientific Research Fisheries Center (TINRO-Center), Vladivostok, Russia]

purpose.p: To report results of the Bering Sea epipelagic layer trawling survey done in fall 2002.

distinfo.distliab: While every effort has been made to ensure that these data are accurate and reliable within the limits of the current state of the art, NOAA cannot assume liability for any damages caused by any errors or omissions in the data, nor as a result of the failure of the data to function on a particular system.
